cause.description:
The National Osteoporosis Foundation (NOF) is the leading consumer and community-focused health organization dedicated to the prevention of osteoporosis and broken bones, the promotion of strong bones for life and the reduction of human suffering through programs of public and clinician awareness, education, advocacy and research.
1. NOF raises money to help fund research, professional health education programs, legislative advocacy, and public awareness campaigns.
2. NOF's goals are to prevent osteoporosis, educate the public and professionals about the disease and treatments, and fund research.
3. NOF does not endorse any product, service or point of view, but does inform the public about all FDA-approved therapies and other products/services.
4. NOF accepts support from a wide breadth of diversified sources, including individuals, foundations, government sources and corporations.
cause.mission: To prevent osteoporosis, to promote lifelong bone health, to help improve the lives of those affected by osteoporosis and related fractures, and to find a cure.
cause.name: National Osteoporosis Foundation
